Still a trace of that old machismo in you, eh? I guess you can't help it. ${loverName} feels flattered that you appreciate her independence and equality.

Your sense of protocol is appreciated, but a little overdone. This is not exactly the Victorian Age any more. These days you run the risk of hurting a woman's feelings by not allowing her to pick up the tab when she wants to.
When you get back to ${loverName}'s house she turns and looks at you with a fiery gleam in her eye. "O.K.," she commands, "GET NAKED!"
The nerve. Just because she picks up the dinner tab, she thinks you will go all the way. Not this sailor. Hrmmph!
Long live the New Woman! ${loverName} puts a strain on your heart that you may never get over, but hey, what a way to go!
Your insistence turns ${loverName} off. Because she has no desire to make a scene, she lets you play out the macho man act. The evening ends on a sour note.
A free meal's a free meal, right? You are a New Man, on the surface at least. It is curious that you didn't at least offer to pay, just for the sake of tradition.
Your personality profile suggests that you can be self-serving at times, so I wonder how much of your behavior reflects an appreciation of the liberated woman, versus a "get-whatever-I-can" attitude.
Your behavior in the past hasn't really been overly self-serving, so I must assume that you really do have an appreciation for the liberated woman.
